title: Our guide to every Week 17 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: Sources: U-M targeting Utes legend Whittingham
content: Utah coach Kyle Whittingham has emerged as the focus of Michigan's coaching search, sources told ESPN.

title: Jokic's 56-point triple-double lifts Nuggets in OT
content: Nikola Jokic recorded a 56-point triple-double and set an NBA record with 18 points in overtime, leading the Nuggets to a 142-138 win over the Timberwolves.

title: Kelce emotional after season finale at Arrowhead
content: The Chiefs' loss to the Broncos might have marked Travis Kelce's final appearance at Arrowhead Stadium, though the star tight end remained noncommittal about his future after the game.

title: Redick rips into Lakers: 'We don't care enough'
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick lit into his team after a blowout loss to the Rockets, saying it doesn't care enough and that the next practice will be "uncomfortable."

title: Longhorns' leading rusher Wisner to enter portal
content: Texas' leading rusher Quintrevion Wisner plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal, the running back's agent Grayson Sheena of AiC Sports told ESPN.

title: Vikes dominate Lions despite woeful passing game
content: The Vikings accomplished the rare feat of winning an NFL game while finishing with fewer than 10 net passing yards.

title: Lions' playoff chances end with loss: 'It sucks'
content: The Lions officially fell out of playoff contention with a 23-10 loss to the Vikings, leaving Detroit to evaluate how it needs to improve.

title: Dak's 'pride' has him planning to play final game
content: Dak Prescott reiterated after Thursday's win that he wants to play in next week's season finale versus the Giants, citing his pride in not finishing below .500 as a team.

title: üèÜ Pop-Tarts Bowl trophy: Behind the scenes
content: How the internet's favorite bowl took things to the next level by making its trophy a kitchen appliance.

title: Reasons for optimism and pessimism for all 10 NBA teams that played on Christmas
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram picks two stats for the teams that played on Dec. 25, and breaks down why fans should be happy and worried about their title aspirations.

content: With first-year success stories, chances at redemption and general silliness, bowl season always delivers.

title: Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Can anyone stop Bayern or Arsenal?
content: As we celebrate the festive season, what better gift than a rerank of the best, most in-form teams across Europe's top five leagues?

content: Are attackers the most valuable players in soccer?  The answer is obvious and impossible -- at the same time.

title: How U.S. Soccer can grow the game with $100 million World Cup windfall
content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?

title: 36 NFL rookies reveal the one big lesson they learned this season
content: Tyler Shough, Isaac TeSlaa and Jalon Walker were among the 36 rookies who learned how humbling and challenging the NFL can be.

content: NFL teams are using sixth O-linemen in more plays this season, and we're highlighting, yep -- six of them.

content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Gallagher loan, Atl√©tico want ‚Ç¨30m
content: Atl√©tico Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher is the subject of interest from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Colton Herta's adaptation to F2 could define IndyCar's global reputation
content: Colton Herta left IndyCar for F2 in hopes of moving up to F1. Whether he succeeds could determine how the world views the American open-wheel series.

title: A miracle child, a priceless penny and a racing legend
content: Back in 1998, long before the United States stopped producing the penny, a little girl with spina bifida gave Dale Earnhardt a gift that raises the question: What if pennies are actually worth everything?

title: End of Ukraine-Russia war? Zelenskyy gives big update; to meet Trump soon
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy will meet US President Trump in Florida this weekend to discuss security guarantees and a nearly finished 20-point peace plan. The talks follow US diplomatic efforts, complicated by Moscow and Kyiv‚Äôs conflicting demands. While Zelenskyy is open to withdrawing troops from parts of eastern Ukraine, Russia insists Ukraine give up remaining Donbas territory.

title: Epstein Saga: How a school teacher with fake degrees became so powerful
content: Before the private jets, the island, and the proximity to presidents and princes, Epstein was a teacher. In the mid-1970s, he taught mathematics and physics at the Dalton School in New York, one of the city‚Äôs most prestigious private institutions. He came from a working-class family in Brooklyn and had never completed a college degree. He fabricated academic credentials to secure the teaching position, and his classroom performance left little impression. Dalton administrators asked him to leave after the academic year. By any conventional measure, this should have marked the limit of his upward mobility. Instead, it marked the moment when social access began to substitute for merit.

title: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt may have agreed with Elon Musk's warning to US govt on China
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt highlights America's stagnant electricity generation, contrasting it with China's massive renewable energy investments, including nuclear and solar.  Elon Musk echoes these concerns, warning of a significant competitive disadvantage for the US as China rapidly expands its power capacity, leaving America behind in the global energy race.

title: Women's safety mirage: What crime data gets wrong & cost of speaking up
content: India's women's safety challenges persist in 2025, with official crime data revealing only a fraction of the reality. Decades of reforms haven't erased gender inequality, social stigma, and uneven justice access, leaving many incidents unreported due to fear, family pressure, and systemic barriers.  This gap between reported crimes and lived experiences highlights the ongoing struggle for safety.

title: Grim roll call of 2025: Indian students who lost their lives this year while studying abroad
content: In 2025, studying abroad felt less like a guaranteed leap forward and more like a journey with hidden risks. A string of Indian student deaths across countries‚Äîsome violent, some sudden, some unresolved‚Äîshook families and campus communities. This year-ender looks at who these students were and what is known so far, beyond rankings, visas and social media gloss.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: Shilpa Shetty personality rights: Bombay High Court orders AI content removal
content: The Bombay High Court on Friday came down heavily on AI-generated and morphed images of Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, terming the content ‚Äúextremely disturbing and shocking‚Äù and directing social media platforms to forthwith delete and remove all such links and websites.

title: Big change: Alexa chief predicts 'death' of app experience; says screen-less future soon
content: Amazon's head of devices, Panos Panay, foresees a future where technology becomes 'ambient,' fading into the background. He predicts younger generations will embrace 'screenless' tech, interacting with AI assistants seamlessly without needing to open apps. Panay believes the ultimate AI assistant form factor is yet to be invented, with Amazon actively exploring new possibilities.

title: Record! Virat Kohli surpasses Australia legend to top the elite list
content: Virat Kohli smashed 77 for Delhi in the Vijay Hazare Trophy to become the highest-averaging batter in List A history, surpassing Michael Bevan. His average now stands at 57.87. Amid doubts over his form, Kohli has scored 584 runs in six 50-over matches and has become the fastest to 16,000 List A runs.

title: 'Have flagged concerns': India on US H-1B visa chaos; notes 'hardships' for families
content: India has raised concerns with the US over the abrupt cancellation of pre-scheduled H-1B visa interviews for thousands of Indian applicants. These interviews, postponed for enhanced social media vetting, have caused significant delays and hardships for skilled workers unable to return to their jobs in the US.

title: ‚Äò$600 mobile bills in NY‚Äô: NRI visits home after 8 yrs; post praises India‚Äôs growth, affordability
content: An NRI's viral post highlights a New York friend's surprise at India's rapid growth and affordability, particularly in healthcare, transport, and digital services. While acknowledging better air quality in the US, the visitor noted significantly lower costs for mobile, health insurance, and property taxes in India. The post sparked discussions on civic sense and the nuances of cost-of-living comparisons.

title: Pragg, Giri or Nakamura? Rapport reveals his pick for Candidates | Exclusive
content: Hungarian GM Rich√°rd Rapport shared insights on the upcoming 2026 Candidates Tournament in Cyprus, saying experience will play a key role. He noted that veterans like Hikaru Nakamura and Fabiano Caruana may play tight games against each other, while decisive results often come against struggling players. Rapport added that lower-seeded players can still create surprises in the round-robin format.

title: Elliotte Friedman warns Maple Leafs face tough talks amid inconsistency
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs are going through a rough patch with inconsistent performances and growing pressure on leadership. Elliotte Friedman has said the team needs to act quickly to improve consistency and accountability. How the Leafs play in the coming games will show if they can get back on track and avoid a difficult stretch this season.

title: Boozeball or Bazball? The hangover of wannabe cricket Ultras reduced to ashes
content: Bazball arrived in Australia preaching fearlessness and fun, but will leave exposed by one of Test cricket‚Äôs harshest conditions. Amid losses, off-field indulgence and mounting criticism, England‚Äôs cult-like philosophy has lost its aura of credibility. As Australia dismantle method and mindset alike, Bazball‚Äôs greatest challenge now isn‚Äôt survival -- it‚Äôs relevance under pressure.

title: Syria: 8 killed in bomb blast at Homs mosque, 21 injured; explosion in Alawite area
content: A mosque bombing in Homs, Syria, during Friday prayers has claimed at least eight lives and injured 21. State media reported explosive devices were planted inside the Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib Mosque. Syria's foreign ministry condemned the "cowardly criminal act," vowing to combat terrorism and hold perpetrators accountable amid rising sectarian tensions.

title: 'I want Pak': Rajnath recalls Vajpayee's unmatched wit; all about iconic moment
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh shared a witty anecdote about former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's response to a Pakistani reporter's marriage proposal.  During a Lahore visit, she offered marriage in exchange for Jammu and Kashmir as 'Mehr'. Vajpayee humorously countered, stating he'd marry her if Pakistan was given as dowry, drawing laughter and applause

title: 'Unremitting hostility': India raps B'desh over lynching of 2nd Hindu man; warns Yunus govt
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly condemned the recent violence against minorities in Bangladesh, including the killing of a Hindu man. The MEA stated that over 2,900 incidents against minorities have been documented, dismissing claims of media exaggeration or political violence.

title: Deja vu, India edition: 10 headlines that remained the same in 2025
content: As 2025 concludes, India witnessed recurring themes: the BJP's continued dominance, the Congress's struggle to revive, persistent air pollution in Delhi, and Pakistan-linked terror. Misogynistic remarks by politicians, language debates, and name-changing initiatives also remained prominent. Cricket stars faced retirement speculation, while the rupee's slide and the perennial 'when will you marry?' question for public figures persisted.

title: Bangladesh Premier League: Not enough balls! Coach walks out of training session
content: Khaled Mahmud walked out of Noakhali Express‚Äôs training ahead of the BPL opener, unhappy with team management and poor facilities. Pace coach Talha joined him after a reported argument over a lack of practice balls and alleged misbehaviour by the owner. Both later returned after being convinced, as BPL officials criticised the franchise‚Äôs unprofessional conduct.

title: 4 skills that will decide who survives the workplace battle in 2026
content: As workplaces evolve rapidly, employers are focusing less on degrees and more on everyday skills. By 2026, adaptability, data understanding, digital comfort, collaboration, and emotional intelligence will shape career growth. Professionals who can adjust to change, work well with others, and manage emotions are more likely to stay relevant in fast-moving work environments.

title: LeBron James gifts daughter a mini house in viral 'goat father' clip
content: NBA legend LeBron James recently delighted fans with a viral throwback video of his daughter, Zhuri Nova James, enjoying a custom-built mini mansion he once gifted her for her birthday. The thoughtful gift, mirroring their own home, showcased James's loving fatherhood and his ability to balance a legendary career with family life. Fans praised the sweet gesture, highlighting the strong bond between the father and the daughter.

title: This is the perfect age gap for happy and long-lasting relationships, according to science
content: Research indicates a 'sweet spot' for age gaps in long-lasting relationships, with zero to three years showing the highest satisfaction. While larger gaps can present challenges, successful couples prioritize open communication, shared values, love, and respect to navigate differences and maintain happiness.

title: Taylor Swift emotional as Travis Kelce calls her the ‚Äòlove of my life‚Äô
content: Taylor Swift's docuseries 'End of an Era' has fans emotional, particularly with a moment in the final episode. Travis Kelce sent Swift a heartfelt bouquet and letter during the last leg of 'The Eras Tour,' calling her 'the love of my life' and recalling their first meeting in Kansas City. The touching gesture has resonated widely on social media.

title: VHT: Scare in Jaipur- KKR batter and Rohit Sharma‚Äôs team-mate suffers serious injury
content: Mumbai batter Angkrish Raghuvanshi was hospitalized after a serious head injury during a Vijay Hazare Trophy match in Jaipur. The 21-year-old, also an IPL player, was stretchered off, causing concern. Earlier, Mumbai posted 331/7, with strong contributions from Musheer Khan, Sarfaraz Khan, and Hardik Tamore. Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a duck.

title: Robert Kraft vs Gayle Benson net worth: How their finances compare
content: NFL titans Robert Kraft and Gayle Benson, both billionaires, showcase contrasting paths to sports ownership. Kraft built a vast empire through diverse investments before acquiring the Patriots, while Benson inherited and expanded her late husband's franchises, the Saints and Pelicans. Their financial journeys highlight distinct strategies for wealth accumulation and franchise management.

title: VHT: 'Fast-track him now'- Ex-India captain compares Suryavanshi to Tendulkar
content: Former India opener Krishnamachari Srikkanth is urging selectors to fast-track teenage sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi into the senior Indian team. Citing Suryavanshi's maturity, technique, and dominance across age-group and domestic cricket, Srikkanth compares his rapid rise to Sachin Tendulkar's early career, advocating for bold backing of rare talent.

title: 6 shots fired: AMU teacher‚Äôs killers kept shooting him in head; murder caught on CCTV
content: Disturbing CCTV footage reveals the execution-style killing of computer teacher Rau Danish Ali on the AMU campus. Attackers lingered, firing repeatedly at the victim's head even after he collapsed. The cold-blooded crime, captured on video, shows the assailants ensuring Ali's death before fleeing on a scooter.

title: CBSE issues SOP to prevent dog-bite incidents and manage stray dogs across school premises
content: CBSE has issued an advisory asking affiliated schools to implement a Standard Operating Procedure to prevent dog-bite incidents and manage stray dogs on school campuses. Following Supreme Court directions, schools must conduct awareness sessions, secure premises, remove stray dogs with help from authorities, appoint nodal officers, ensure regular inspections, improve waste management under PM POSHAN guidelines, and support MoHFW rabies elimination efforts.

title: From foot to head: How Chinese doctors kept a severed ear alive; reattached it months later
content: In a remarkable feat of reconstructive surgery, Chinese doctors successfully grafted a woman's severed ear onto her foot to preserve it. After a severe workplace accident, the ear was reattached to her head following extensive scalp reconstruction. This innovative procedure highlights China's history of pioneering, unconventional medical interventions for severe injuries.

title: The Rs 40 shot: Inside cough syrup racket hooking teens across states; 78 arrested in UP
content: A vast illicit economy fueled by codeine-based cough syrups is thriving across East UP and beyond, preying on youth and laborers. Investigations reveal a multi-crore racket involving diversion from legal channels, with kingpins orchestrating a complex smuggling network. Authorities are intensifying crackdowns, with multiple arrests and probes underway.

title: UGC NET December 2025 city intimation slip: NTA issues important notice; details here
content: The National Testing Agency has issued a notice for UGC-NET December 2025 candidates regarding the City Intimation Slip. Candidates are warned against using CSIR-NET links, as doing so may cause technical issues. The City Intimation Slip must be downloaded only from the official UGC-NET portal. Candidates are advised to use correct login details, follow official instructions, and contact NTA support if needed.

title: World Rapid & Blitz: ‚ÄòNot great‚Äô - Carlsen on relations with FIDE
content: Magnus Carlsen has returned for the 2025 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships in Doha, held from December 26 to 30 with a ‚Ç¨1 million prize fund. The world number one said personal and family ties with the Qatar organisers were central to his decision. His relationship with FIDE remains strained after last year‚Äôs ‚Äújeansgate‚Äù controversy.

title: Prodigy to national honour: Sooryavanshi conferred with PM Rashtriya Bal Puraskar ‚Äì Watch
content: Young batting prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, just 14, has been honored with the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar. His remarkable year includes an IPL contract, a 58-ball century for India U19, and breaking multiple records in T20 and List A cricket, including the fastest IPL hundred and fastest youth ODI century.  His meteoric rise continues to captivate the nation.

title: Sleep disorders in cancer patients: Causes, effects and ways to improve rest
content: Cancer patients frequently battle sleep disorders, impacting their recovery and well-being. Tumours, treatments like chemotherapy, and emotional stress disrupt sleep, leading to fatigue and anxiety. Insomnia is common, but other issues like sleep apnoea can also arise. Addressing these sleep problems is crucial for improving a patient's quality of life and treatment adherence.

title: BJP scripts history in Kerala: VV Rajesh elected Thiruvananthapuram mayor
content: VV Rajesh made history as the first BJP Mayor of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, winning with 51 votes. He garnered support from 50 BJP councillors and one independent. The UDF candidate received 17 votes, and the LDF candidate secured 29 votes in the election.

title: State launches new campaign for good health
content: A rally was flagged off from Kasaragod on December 26 as part of the campaign promotion. It is expected to reach Thiruvananthapuram on January 1 when it will be launched formally

title: Full-body advertisements on buses fetch BMTC ‚Çπ57.5 crore a year; ‚Çπ230 crore eyed over next four years
content: As part of a renewed push to augment earnings through alternative revenue streams, BMTC, beginning January this year, introduced full-body advertisement wraps on 3,400 of its buses

title: End attacks on Hindus, Suvendu tells Bangladesh Deputy High Commission
content: Will continue protests outside the commission if attacks don‚Äôt stop, BJP leader-led delegation tells officials

title: JD (S) will contest local bodies elections independently, says HDD
content: The alliance with BJP will continue for Lok Sabha and Legislative Assembly polls, the former Prime Minister says

title: New Mayor V.K. Minimol vows crackdown on corruption, focus on mobility
content: The new Mayor of the Kochi Corporation outlines her priorities and vision for the city, which she says are aligned with the broader agenda of the UDF and will be reflected in the maiden budget to be presented by the new governing committee in the coming months.

title: Christian forum hails PM‚Äôs visit to Delhi church, asks government to take strong action on acts of violence against community
content: Rev. Asir Ebenezer, general secretary, NCCI says the Prime Minister‚Äôs visit, particularly at a time when attacks on Christians are reported from various places in the country, is perceived as a reassuring signal to the community

title: O. Sadasivan is new Mayor of Kozhikode
content: S. Jayasree of the CPI(M) is the new deputy mayor;  the whole council will work together for the development of the city, says new Mayor

title: ‚ÄòPressed by authorities‚Äô, Mirwaiz drops Hurriyat chairman title from X bio
content: Umar Farooq‚Äôs decision draws a range of reactions from political leaders in Kashmir; Mehbooba Mufti says Hurriyat was ‚Äúan idea and represented the alienation felt by people‚Äù

title: Prashant Jagtap joins Congress after quitting Sharad Pawar-led NCP faction
content: Former Pune mayor cites ideological differences ahead of civic elections; blames BJP for rising crime and worsening traffic conditions in the city

title: Crime in the garb of politics will not be tolerated, warns Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The government will also not tolerate those resorting to character assassination of political opponents through abusive posts, he asserts, and calls upon parties to maintain decency and decorum expected in a political system

title: Development, not controversy, our focus: Thrissur DCC president
content: Joseph Tajet says Congress candidates received support even from councillors who were earlier fellow travellers of the Left, underscoring that development-oriented politics prevailed over allegations and disputes

title: New Mayors, municipal chairpersons take charge in Kerala
content: V.V. Rajesh takes over as the first BJP Mayor of the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, four United Democratic Front Mayors, three of them women, take oath in Kollam, Kochi, Thrissur, and Kannur Corporations. The lone LDF Mayor, O. Sadasivan, sworn in as Mayor of the Kozhikode Corporation

title: Veligonda Project to be completed by 2026, says Minister
content: After reviewing progress, Nimmala directs completion of Tunnel-2 lining by June 2026 and faster execution of feeder canal and retaining wall works to ensure water release in the current season

title: Lighting of candles, silent marches mark tsunami anniversary
content: Memorial programmes included silent procession in 28 coastal villages in Mayiladuthurai district; Collector, SP attend programme at Tsunami Memorial Park in Nagapattinam

title: Telangana HC dismisses plea over temple land title claims
content: Petitioners moved the High Court against decision of Joint Collector confirming the order of RDO issuing Occupancy Rights Certificate to Deval Balaji

title: Naidu calls for a balance between modern science and traditional knowledge
content: He exhorts parents and teachers to narrate to children the noble characters in our epics to inculcate in them qualities like honesty, courage, commitment, responsibility and wisdom

title: Bird flu: culling of birds begins in Alappuzha
content: Officials of  Animal Husbandry department say that rapid response teams have so far culled 4,240 birds in the district

title: Centre's guidelines on Aravalli issue misleading, attempt to loot: Deepender Hooda
content: The Congress MP said the Centre's arguments on the Aravalli hills issue in the Supreme Court were flawed and malicious in intent

title: Abhishek Banerjee Explains Trinamool Strategy To All District Leaders
content: Abhishek Banerjee held a virtual meeting today with all district leaders and workers of the Trinamool Congress. Office bearers and employees from multiple districts attended the meeting, where Banerjee gave a voice boost.

title: Video: Man Sets Panchayat Office Ablaze, Accuses Officials Of Neglect
content: A video showing a man setting fire to a panchayat office in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam district has gone viral on social media.

title: "I Froze": Bengaluru Woman Recounts Harassment During Metro Ride
content: A 25-year-old woman has alleged that she was inappropriately touched and subjected to obscene behaviour by a fellow passenger while travelling on a Namma Metro train in central Bengaluru.

title: NDTV Ground Report: What's It Like To Be A Hindu In Bangladesh
content: Hindus in Bangladesh's troubled capital Dhaka in an exclusive conversation with NDTV's Ankit Tyagi, who is at ground zero, narrated the horrors they faced and concerns they have as attacks on them by radical Islamists.

title: "Probe Into Pahalgam Terror Attack Will Put Pak In The Dock": Amit Shah
content: The people of India have given a strong and befitting reply to "Pakistan's terrorist masters" through its security forces by carrying out a successful investigation of the Pahalgam terrorist attack, Home Minister Amit Shah said Friday.

title: In This Bihar District, A Crematorium And A School Coexist
content: Pyres burn on one side while, just a few meters away, children study in a school located within a crematorium in Muzaffarpur, Bihar. Despite the surroundings, the students say they feel no fear and attend classes regularly.

title: What Tarique Rahman's Return To Bangladesh Means For India
content: A lawyer aligned with the pro-Pakistan Jamaat-E-Islami Bangladesh has issued a death threat to Tarique Rahman, just hours after the Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader landed in the country after 17 years in exile.

title: Petition Filed To Stop Festival At Dargah At Centre Of Tamil Nadu Deepam Row
content: A writ petition has been filed before the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court seeking directions not to permit the 'Kanthuri' festival at a dargah located atop the Thiruparankundram hill in the district on January 6 over animal sacrifice.

title: Bangladesh Unrest News Live: What Tarique Rahman's Entry In Bangladesh Means For India Amid Jamaat Threats
content: Bangladesh Crisis LIVE: Another¬†Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, days after Dipu Chandra Das was lynched and his body was set ablaze, local media reported on Thursday.¬†

title: Hoteliers In Bengal's Darjeeling, Malda Close Doors For Bangladesh Tourists
content: Hoteliers' associations in two districts of West Bengal, on Friday, have decided to close the doors of their hotels and lodges as a mark of protest against the recent lynching of Dipu Chandra Das.

title: Delhi High Court Asks Centre Why GST On Air Purifiers Can't Be Lowered
content: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Centre why it cannot reduce the GST charged on air purifiers to make it affordable for the common man in view of the worsening air quality in the national capital and nearby areas.

title: 1 Killed, Another Injured After Fire At Four-Storey Building In Delhi
content: A 20-year-old man died and another person sustained injuries after a fire broke in a four-storey building in northeast Delhi's Mustafabad area on Friday morning

title: Video: SUV In Nitish Kumar's Convoy Hits Senior Cop From Behind
content: A senior police officer sustained minor injuries on Friday after a vehicle in Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's convoy accidentally hit him.

title: On Camera, Israeli Soldier Rams Vehicle Into Palestinian Man Offering Namaz
content: An Israeli reservist soldier with a rifle slung on his back rammed an ATV into a Palestinian man who was praying on the side of a road in the occupied West Bank on Thursday, the Israeli military has said.

title: 8 Killed, 18 Injured In Bombing At Mosque In Syria During Friday Prayers
content: An explosion hit worshippers at a mosque in a predominantly Alawite area of Syria's Homs on Friday, state media said, killing at least eight in the latest attack on the minority community.

title: Stray Dogs To Aravallis: Supreme Court's 10 Big Rulings In 2025
content: From stray dogs to executive powers, the Supreme Court delivered some impactful judgments in 2025 that influenced law, governance, and public life across India.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Jana Nayagan vs. Parasakthi: The Politics Playing Out On Tamil Nadu's Screens
content: This is not merely a contest between two films; it is a proxy battle for political space, symbolism, and supremacy.

title: Boy, 10, Delivered Tea, Lassi To Soldiers During Op Sindoor, Gets Bal Puraskar
content: He is 10 years old, but showed a big heart. Shravan Singh, amidst the risks associated with war during Operation Sindoor, regularly delivered water, milk, and lassi to the Indian soldiers stationed at the border near his home in Punjab's Ferozepur.

title: Video: Wild Boar Mauls Forest Officer, Strikes With Sticks Don't Help
content: A forest department officer was injured after a wild boar attacked him during a rescue operation in Uttar Pradesh's Badaun district on Friday.

title: Opinion: Blog | Rahul vs Priyanka? Not Really
content: The rumours about apower struggle within the Congress may just be that: rumours. For now, there is no vacancy in the Congress.

title: Cong.‚Äôs Reetha Paul is Angamaly municipal chairperson; Sangeetha K.S. in Perumbavoor
content: The Congress and its allies secured chairperson and deputy chairperson posts in Angamaly, Aluva, Perumbavoor, North Paravur, Muvattupuzha and Piravom municipalities

title: Death toll in cylinder blast near Mysuru palace rises to two
content: Minister says he will direct authorities to take steps to prevent such mishaps by studying the reasons behind the incident

title: Incumbent Director-Life Sciences of TG to continue till March
content: Sarvesh Singh, appointed to the post recently, will work closely with Shakthi Nagappan, who after March will be honorary advisor to the Industries Minister

title: Kochi Mayor was chosen strictly in accordance with KPCC guidelines, says Satheesan
content: The UDF had announced mayoral candidates in advance only in Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam, says Satheesan

title: UDF hands over chairperson position to IUML in Thodupuzha municipality
content: Under the new UDF power-sharing agreement, IUML‚Äôs Sabira Jaleel will serve as the chairperson for the next two years. The Kerala Congress (Joseph) faction will then hold the post for one year, followed by a Congress councillor for the final two years

title: SDPI support to UDF in Kollam Corporation sparks political row
content: CPI(M) acting district secretary S. Jayamohan says UDF secured its victory by aligning not only with BJP but also with minority communal forces like Jamaat-e-Islami and SDPI

title: Denied mayoral post due to lack of money, says Congress councillor in Thrissur
content: Laly James alleges that mayoral post was sold for cash, levels serious charges against party leadership and Niji Justin, who later took charge as Mayor

title: Rashid Ullampilly in Thrikkakara, Laiji Sajeevan in Eloor
content: The UDF has secured chairperson and vice-chairperson posts in Thrikkakara, Maradu, Kalamassery, Koothattukulam and Kothamangalam municipalities, while the LDF won only Eloor, the sole civic body it retained in Ernakulam

title: Rural development suffered a setback during YSRCP‚Äôs tenure, alleges TDP MLC
content: Alapati Rajendra Prasad accuses former Chief Minister Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy of diverting funds meant for village development and running a parallel system through volunteers

title: Thar Desert could expand up to Delhi, warns Sachin Pilot over threat to Aravalli hills
content: Sachin Pilot joins NSUI‚Äôs ‚ÄòSave Aravalli‚Äô march, slams Centre‚Äôs new definition that leaves 90% of hills unprotected

title: UDF secures power in all six municipalities in Kottayam
content: 21-year-old Diya Binu Pulikkakandam who was elected chairperson of the Pala municipality becomes one of the youngest municipal chairpersons in the country.

title: Indian Railways plan to double originating train capacity in 48 major cities by 2030: Ministry
content: The Railway Ministry added that the current infrastructure needs to be augmented so as to meet the requirements of the upcoming years

title: 473 full-service Aadhaar centres from September 2026: UIDAI CEO
content: UIDAI CEO Bhuvnesh Kumar says there are 88 full-fledged Aadhaar centres in India, the new centres will help adult applicants who at times have to traverse districts to find a centre

title: KGMOA  protests against change CHC timings
content: A government order issued on December 20 says the CHCs should function from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. The current timing is 9 a.m. to 2 p.m.

title: Congress alleges ‚Çπ112 crore kickback benefited former Prasar Bharati chief Navneet Kumar Sehgal
content: The Congress party questions PM Modi‚Äôs silence and also accuses UP CM Yogi Adityanath of shielding Sehgal¬†¬†¬†

title: A.K. Hafeez assumes office as first UDF Mayor of Kollam
content: The transition signifies the end of a quarter-century of uninterrupted governance by LDF and a major realignment in the region‚Äôs political landscape. The council also elects Udaya Sukumaran of Tangassery division as the Deputy Mayor

title: Government is giving health sector top priority, says Minister
content: Inaugurates Community Health Centre, constructed at a cost of ‚Çπ5.33 crore from NABARD funds. Says the 30-bedded hospital will benefit the people of nearby villages as they were forced to visit the government hospital at Nandyal for their medical needs

title: CM Stalin inaugurates new projects worth ‚Çπ1,773.67 crore
content: He inaugurated a total of 2,525 completed projects and laid the foundation stone for 62 new ones. He also announced the creation of a new SIPCOT industrial estate at an estimated cost of ‚Çπ10 crore in Ulundurpet

title: Kolusu holds Praja Darbar, directs officials to resolve grievances
content: The Minister receives 16 petitions from four mandals at Nuzvid, warns of strict action against delays in grievance redressal

title: Rajasthan CM hits back at Gehlot over Aravalli remarks, says no tampering will be allowed
content: Rajasthan CM Bhajanlal Sharma alleged that it was during Congress regimes that extensive mining activity took place in the Aravalli area and questioned who had altered the definition of the mountain range in 2002-03 and 2009-10

title: CM to participate in CWC meeting today, likely to seek high command‚Äôs nod for Cabinet reshuffle
content: The CWC meeting is unlikely to take up the leadership change issue; Siddaramaiah may place a request on appointment of a new KPCC president, according to sources

title: Andhra Pradesh CID busts international cybercrime racket, arrests 14 persons
content: In raids conducted in various States, the CID teams have confiscated 14 SIM boxes, 1,496 SIM cards, eight routers, seven cameras, 22 cellphones, and other electronic gadgets, say police

title: Hiriyur bus fire once again raises concern about safety of sleeper coaches
content: Industry representatives acknowledge that sleeper buses, while popular, come with inherent safety challenges

title: Karkala‚Äôs Yaksha Rangayana to perform three plays in Bengaluru
content: Yaksha¬†Rangayana,¬†established¬†in¬†Karkala¬†in¬†March¬†2022,¬†is among the six¬†branches¬†of¬†Rangayana¬†in the State.

content: Socialist Unity Centre of India (Communist) members stage a demonstration in front of Dharwad Railway Station

content: Acquitting the mother, the HC observed there is no IPC section to punish her for "trying to protect her Raja beta"

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
